**Antique Appraiser Directory: Charlotte, NC**  

### **Overview of Antique Appraisal Services**  
Charlotte offers specialized antique appraisal services through credentialed professionals experienced in art, furniture, jewelry, collectibles, and IRS-compliant valuations ([1][2]). Key specialties include insurance documentation, estate planning/liquidation support ([3]), charitable donation assessments ([1]), and litigation-related fair division evaluations ([9]).  

---

### **List of Antique Appraisers**  

#### **Prestige Estate Services Team**  
*Full-service personal property appraisal firm*  
- **Edward Kitson**, **Elizabeth Lovett**, **Stephanie Calman**  
  - *Specialties*: Fine art collections | Antique furniture | Jewelry | Charitable donation compliance | Divorce/inheritance valuations  
  - *Certifications*: ISA Members | USPAP-Compliant | IRS Qualified  
  - *Years Active*: Over a decade combined experience ([1][2])  
- **Contact**:  
  501 S College St #2000-A4 • (844) 378-7253 • Open Mon–Fri (9 AM–5 PM)  

#### **Coinfully – Specialty Numismatic Appraiser**  
- **Wyatt McDonald**, President & Co-Founder (*Coins/Certified Collections*)    
  - *Specialties*: Rare coins | Graded collections | Insurance/inheritance evaluations   
    Offers free at-home or virtual consultations nationwide ([7]).   
    Free local pickup upon sale agreement.    
  401 Hawthorne Ln • Contact via website form • Open daily by appointment   

---

### **Service Areas & Pricing**  
- *Coverage*: Greater Charlotte metro area (**Matthews**, Concord*, Huntersville*, Pineville*, Gastonia*, Fort Mill*) + remote options nationwide ([1][7]).    
- *Typical Pricing* (**Varies by item complexity/appraisal type**) :    
   - In-person/remote sessions starting at $150/hour ([2][6])   
   - Photo-based valuations ($50–$100/item) or flat fees per collection size   
   - Insurance/donation reports ($75–$200+ per item depending on documentation depth)    

---

### Additional Notes:
For broader real estate valuation needs (*e.g., home equity assessments linked to estates*), firms like Eagle Home Appraisal provide USPAP-compliant residential reports starting at $400+ ([5][9]).
